page.title: 10Flowers of Moorland Villages
page.content: In the many habitats we find acid loving plants, woodland,marsh species, and also the lime lovers,such as thyme which grow on the shallow layer of soil above the limestone rock. These flourish in the several quarries. The famous heather moors are mostly ling but there is also bell heather and cross-leaved heath. Bilberries, crow- berries,cowberries and sweet gale grow there. Bracken has increased greatly over the years,possibly due partly to it not being cut now. In springtime violets, primroses, wood sorrel, wood anemone,cowslips and celandine grow in profusion. False oxslips are in some woods. Masses of wild daffodils grow along the banks of the river from Lowna northwards.This is the south end of the famous Farndale daffodils. Later flowers include wild roses, St.John's wort,guelder roses and more.
